response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age", "medium", "Being 22 reflects youth, which carries moderate risk though it is common among recidivists."),
    ("Race", "low", "Race alone is not a strong predictor of recidivism and should be considered in broader context."),
    ("Arrest History", "high", "Nine arrests with convictions indicate a pattern of criminal behavior, a strong risk factor."),
    ("Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight are not relevant to criminal recidivism risk."),
    ("Marital Status", "medium", "Never married and living alone may contribute to isolation, which is moderately associated with risk."),
    ("Education", "medium", "Having a GED without further higher education limits opportunities for rehabilitation, representing moderate risk."),
    ("Employment", "medium", "Holding one job during the year suggests economic instability and moderate risk of recidivism."),
    ("Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use indicates some level of substance-related behavior, contributing moderate risk."),
    ("Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms indicates possible underlying issues that can contribute to recidivism risk."),
    ("Family and Upbringing", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of four may indicate environmental influences that impart moderate risk."),
    ("Religious Belief", "low", "Believing that God influences personal events is not strongly linked to increased recidivism risk and may provide community support.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being 22 reflects youth, which carries moderate risk though it is common among recidivists.
Race alone is not a strong predictor of recidivism and should be considered in broader context.
Nine arrests with convictions indicate a pattern of criminal behavior, a strong risk factor.
Height and weight are not relevant to criminal recidivism risk.
Never married and living alone may contribute to isolation, which is moderately associated with risk.
Having a GED without further higher education limits opportunities for rehabilitation, representing moderate risk.
Holding one job during the year suggests economic instability and moderate risk of recidivism.
Recent marijuana use indicates some level of substance-related behavior, contributing moderate risk.
Experiencing depressive symptoms indicates possible underlying issues that can contribute to recidivism risk.
Growing up in an urban household of four may indicate environmental influences that impart moderate risk.
Believing that God influences personal events is not strongly linked to increased recidivism risk and may provide community support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 9 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
